Package FinanceTrackerSystem.Controllers

Class UserController

java.lang.Object
FinanceTrackerSystem.Controllers.UserController
public class UserController extends Object
Provides static methods to manage user profiles, authentication, and persistence in the Finance Tracker System. This controller supports creating user profiles, loading and saving user data, retrieving users by profile or ID, and managing the currently logged-in user.

Responsibilities

  • Create new user profiles and add them to the system.
  • Authenticate users by profile details and user type.
  • Retrieve users by unique ID.
  • Manage the currently logged-in user for session-based operations.
  • Persist all user data to disk and load it on startup.

Usage Example

 UUID userId = UserController.createUserProfile("Alice", "123 Main St", "555-1234", LocalDate.of(1990, 1, 1),
         UserType.REGULAR);
 UserController.getUserIdByProfile("Alice", LocalDate.of(1990, 1, 1), UserType.REGULAR);
 User user = UserController.getUserById(userId);
 UserController.saveUsersDetails();
 UserController.loadUsersDetails();
 User current = UserController.getCurrentUser();

Dependencies

  • User - The user model being managed.
  • UserProfile - The profile details for each user.
  • UserType - Enum for user type (ADMIN, REGULAR).

Thread Safety

This class is not thread-safe. All operations assume single-threaded access to the static user list and current user. If used in a multi-threaded environment, external synchronization is required.

Persistence

User data is serialized to and deserialized from the file specified by USER_PROFILE_FILE. The static block ensures user data is loaded when the class is first accessed.

Validation

This class performs basic validation (e.g., existence of user, matching profile details). Further validation (such as input format or duplicate users) should be handled externally.

Extensibility

Additional user operations (such as password management, session expiration, or audit logging) can be added as needed.

  • Field Details

    • USER_PROFILE_FILE

      public static final String USER_PROFILE_FILE
      Path to the file where user profiles are serialized and stored. This should be an absolute path to ensure consistent access across sessions.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • users

      public static List<User> users
      List of all users in the system. This list is populated on startup and updated whenever users are added or modified.

    • currentUser

      public static User currentUser
      The currently logged-in user. This field is set during authentication and used for session-based operations.

  • Constructor Details

    • UserController

      public UserController()

  • Method Details

    • getCurrentUser

      public static User getCurrentUser()
      Returns the currently logged-in user.
      Returns:
      The current User object, or null if no user is logged in.

    • saveUsersDetails

      public static boolean saveUsersDetails()
      Saves all user details to the file specified by USER_PROFILE_FILE. This method should be called after any modification to user data to ensure persistence. Uses Java serialization to write the user list to disk.
      Returns:
      true if user details are saved successfully; false otherwise.

    • loadUsersDetails

      public static void loadUsersDetails()
      Loads all user details from the file specified by USER_PROFILE_FILE. Populates the static users list. If the file does not exist or is corrupted, the user list remains empty and an error message is printed. Uses Java deserialization to read the user list from disk.

    • createUserProfile

      public static UUID createUserProfile(String name, String address, String phoneNumber, LocalDate dob, UserType type)
      Creates a new user profile and adds it to the system. Also sets the newly created user as the current user for the session. The new user is persisted to disk.
      Parameters:
      name - Name of the user.
      address - Address of the user.
      phoneNumber - Phone number of the user.
      dob - Date of birth of the user.
      type - Type of the user (e.g., ADMIN, REGULAR).
      Returns:
      UUID of the newly created user if successful; null otherwise.

    • getUserIdByProfile

      public static UUID getUserIdByProfile(String name, LocalDate dob, UserType type)
      Authenticates a user by matching profile details and user type. If a matching user is found, sets the user as the current user for the session. Prints a success or failure message to the console.
      Parameters:
      name - Name of the user.
      dob - Date of birth of the user.
      type - Type of the user.
      Returns:
      UUID of the user if authentication is successful; null otherwise.

    • getUserById

      public static User getUserById(UUID userId)
      Retrieves a user by their unique ID. Searches the static users list for a user with the specified UUID.
      Parameters:
      userId - UUID of the user.
      Returns:
      User object if found; null otherwise.
